intro: Carum streyi, commonly known as the Balkan caraway, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly spicy aroma. Carum streyi is often found in meadows and grasslands, thriving in temperate climates.
